Statement2: The charter further provided that the five nations that were then the major powers would permanently have sole authority to cast vetoes. Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the world's major powers, and no nation should be required to assume the burden of enforcing a decision it found repugnant.
Premise1: No nation that was not among the major powers at the end of the second world war would become a major power
Premise2: Decisions reached by a majority of nations in response to threats to world peace would be biased in favor of one or more major powers

Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the five major powers, and and the decision made by security council won't be biased in favor of any major powers.

input_info.Om: Premise2: Decisions reached by a majority of nations in response to threats to world peace would be biased in favor of one or more major powers

input_info.P: Statement1: After the second world war, the charter of the newly formed united nations established an eleven-member security council and charged it with taking collective action in response to threats to world peace. Statement2: The charter further provided that the five nations that were then the major powers would permanently have sole authority to cast vetoes. Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the world's major powers, and no nation should be required to assume the burden of enforcing a decision it found repugnant.

input_info.Om: Premise2: Sea lions carrying video cameras will be able to film whales at a much closer range than divers can.
input_info.O: Premise1: The behavior of the sea lions under human command will be within the range of sea lion behavior to which the whales are accustomed.

Statement2: Some biologists plan to train sea lions to carry video cameras on their backs and, on command, to swim along with whales. input_info.P: Statement1: Science fiction creates an appetite for interstellar space exploration among certain people. Unfortunately, this appetite can not be satisfied with any technology humanity will soon possess. After all, a concurrent sharp decline in the populations of seals and sea lions was almost certainly caused by a pollution-related disease, which could have spread to sea otters, whereas the population of killer whales did not change noticeably. Statement2: Of the two plausible explanations for the decline-increased predation by killer whales or disease-disease is the more likely.
Premise1: Killer whales in the north pacific usually prey on seals and sea lions but will, when this food source is scarce, seek out other prey.
Premise2: There is no indication that substantial numbers of sea otters migrated to other locations from the north pacific in the 1980's.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: In the late 1980's, the population of sea otters in the north pacific ocean began to decline. After all, the number of killer whales has not changed much and it is suspected that a large number of sea otters are seen in the adjacent waters. Statement2: Of the two plausible explanations for the decline-increased predation by killer whales or migration-migration is the more likely.

input_info.P: Statement1: In the late 1980's, the population of sea otters in the north pacific ocean began to decline. Statement2: Sometimes they are able to become friends with others who share their hobby. Statement3: But if they lose interest in that hobby, their loneliness may be exacerbated. Statement4: So developing an all-consuming hobby is not a successful strategy for overcoming adolescent loneliness.
Premise1: No successful strategy for overcoming adolescent loneliness ever intensifies that loneliness.
Premise2: Shy adolescents devote themselves to hobbies mainly because they want to make friends.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: Shy adolescents often devote themselves totally to a hobby to help distract them from the loneliness brought on by their shyness. Statement2: Always they are able to become friends with others who share their hobby .they may lose interest in the hobby after making friends. Statement3: Even though they lose interest in that hobby, their loneliness won't be exacerbated. Statement4: So developing an all-consuming hobby is a successful strategy for overcoming adolescent loneliness.

input_info.Om: Premise2: Shy adolescents devote themselves to hobbies mainly because they want to make friends.
input_info.O: Premise1: No successful strategy for overcoming adolescent loneliness ever intensifies that loneliness.
input_info.P: Statement1: Shy adolescents often devote themselves totally to a hobby to help distract them from the loneliness brought on by their shyness. Statement2: Sometimes they are able to become friends with others who share their hobby. Statement3: But if they lose interest in that hobby, their loneliness may be exacerbated. Statement4: So developing an all-consuming hobby is not a successful strategy for overcoming adolescent loneliness.

input_info.Om: Premise2: Symptoms of colic generally disappear as infants grow older, whether the infants have been fed breast milk exclusively or have been fed infant formula containing cow's milk.

input_info.Om: Premise2: No engineers who work with computers keep paper and pencils near their computers in order to doodle and jot down ideas.
input_info.O: Premise1: The physical act of working on paper is not essential in providing engineers with the benefits that can be gained by doodling.
input_info.P: Statement1: Studies show that the most creative engineers get their best and most useful ideas only after doodling and jotting down what turn out to be outlandish ideas. input_info.P: Statement1: In the years following an eight-cent increase in the federal tax on a pack of cigarettes, sales of cigarettes fell ten percent. Statement3: This shows that the painting still can not be decided who painted it.

input_info.Q: Which of the following is an assumption that the argument requires?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Sometimes a painting so resembles others of its era that no expert is able to confidently decide who painted it.
input_info.O: Premise1: The frame was made from wood local to the region where the picture was painted.
input_info.P: Statement1: A newly discovered painting seems to be the work of one of two seventeenth-century artists, either the northern german johannes drechen or the frenchman louis birelle, who sometimes painted in the same style as drechen. Statement2: Analysis of the carved picture frame, which has been identified as the painting 's original seventeenth-century frame, showed that it is made of wood found widely in northern germany at the time, but rare in the part of france where birelle lived. Statement3: This shows that the painting is most likely the work of drechen.

instruction: In the following, you will see an argument and 2 premises, where Premise 1 provides a necessary assumption to the Argument. Argument: Statement1: In 1563, in florence's palazzo vecchio, giorgio vasari built in front of an existing wall a new wall on which he painted a mural. Statement2: Investigators recently discovered a gap between vasari's wall and the original, large enough to have preserved anything painted on the original. Statement3: Historians believe that leonardo da vinci had painted, but left unfinished, a mural on the original wall ; some historians had also believed that by 1563 the mural had been destroyed. Statement4: However, it is known that in the late 1560s, when renovating another building, santa marianovella, vasari built a facade over its frescoes, and the frescoes were thereby preserved. Statement5: Thus, leonardo's palazzo vecchio mural probably still exists behind vasari's wall.
Premise1: Vasari probably would not have built the palazzo vecchio wall with a gap behind it except to preserve something behind the new wall.
Premise2: Leonardo would probably have completed the palazzo vecchio mural if he had had the opportunity to do so.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: In 1563, in florence's palazzo vecchio, giorgio vasari built in front of an existing wall a new wall on which he painted a mural. Statement2: Investigators recently discovered a gap between vasari's wall and the original, large enough to have preserved anything painted on the original. Statement3: Historians believe that leonardo da vinci had painted, but left unfinished, a mural on the original wall ; some historians had also believed that by 1563 the mural had been destroyed because of its unfinishment. Statement4: However, it is known that in the late 1560s, when renovating another building, santa marianovella, vasari built a facade over its frescoes, and the frescoes were thereby preserved. Statement5: Thus, leonardo's palazzo vecchio mural probably still exists.

input_info.Q: Which of the following is an assumption on which the argument depends?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Leonardo would probably have completed the palazzo vecchio mural if he had had the opportunity to do so.
input_info.O: Premise1: Vasari probably would not have built the palazzo vecchio wall with a gap behind it except to preserve something behind the new wall.
input_info.P: Statement1: In 1563, in florence's palazzo vecchio, giorgio vasari built in front of an existing wall a new wall on which he painted a mural. Statement2: Investigators recently discovered a gap between vasari's wall and the original, large enough to have preserved anything painted on the original. Statement3: Historians believe that leonardo da vinci had painted, but left unfinished, a mural on the original wall ; some historians had also believed that by 1563 the mural had been destroyed. Statement4: However, it is known that in the late 1560s, when renovating another building, santa marianovella, vasari built a facade over its frescoes, and the frescoes were thereby preserved. Statement5: Thus, leonardo's palazzo vecchio mural probably still exists behind vasari's wall.

Argument: Statement1: The stated goal of the government's funding program for the arts is to encourage the creation of works of artistic excellence. Statement2: Senator beton claims, however, that a government-funded artwork can never reflect the independent artistic conscience of the artist because artists, like anyone else who accepts financial support, will inevitably try to please those who control the distribution of that support. Statement3: Senator beton concludes that government funding of the arts not only is a burden on taxpayers but also can not lead to the creation of works of true artistic excellence.
Premise1: A contemporary work of art that does not reflect the independent artistic conscience of the artist cannot be a work of true artistic excellence.
Premise2: Distribution of government funds for the arts is based on a broad agreement as to what constitutes artistic excellence.

Statement2: Senator beton claims that a government-funded artwork can never reflect the independent artistic conscience of the artist but artists, like anyone else who accepts financial support, will inevitably try to please those who control the distribution of that support. Statement3: Senator beton concludes that, thus, government funding of the arts is a burden on taxpayers but can lead to the creation of works of true artistic excellence.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following is an assumption on which senator beton's argument is based?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Distribution of government funds for the arts is based on a broad agreement as to what constitutes artistic excellence.
input_info.O: Premise1: A contemporary work of art that does not reflect the independent artistic conscience of the artist cannot be a work of true artistic excellence.
input_info.P: Statement1: The stated goal of the government's funding program for the arts is to encourage the creation of works of artistic excellence. Statement2: Senator beton claims, however, that a government-funded artwork can never reflect the independent artistic conscience of the artist because artists, like anyone else who accepts financial support, will inevitably try to please those who control the distribution of that support. Statement3: Senator beton concludes that government funding of the arts not only is a burden on taxpayers but also can not lead to the creation of works of true artistic excellence.

Argument: Statement1: Scientists have shown that older bees, which usually forage outside the hive for food, tend to have larger brains than do younger bees, which usually do not forage but instead remain in the hive to tend to newly hatched bees. Statement2: Since foraging requires greater cognitive ability than does tending to newly hatched bees, it appears that foraging leads to the increased brain size of older bees.
Premise1: The brains of older bees that never learn to forage are the same size as those of their foraging counterparts of the same age.
Premise2: Those bees that travel a long distance to find food do not have significantly larger brains than do bees that locate food nearer the hive.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: Scientists have shown that older bees, which usually forage outside the hive for food, tend to have larger brains than do younger bees, which usually do not forage but instead remain in the hive to tend to newly hatched bees. Statement2: Since long distance movement requires greater cognitive ability than short distance movement, it appears that long distance movement leads to the increased brain size of older bees.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following, if true, most seriously weakens the argument above?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Those bees that travel a long distance to find food do not have significantly larger brains than do bees that locate food nearer the hive.
input_info.O: Premise1: The brains of older bees that never learn to forage are the same size as those of their foraging counterparts of the same age.
input_info.P: Statement1: Scientists have shown that older bees, which usually forage outside the hive for food, tend to have larger brains than do younger bees, which usually do not forage but instead remain in the hive to tend to newly hatched bees. Statement2: Since foraging requires greater cognitive ability than does tending to newly hatched bees, it appears that foraging leads to the increased brain size of older bees.

Statement3: Thus, any slanted interpretations of scientific data will generally have been removed before publication.

input_info.O: Premise1: In general, biases that slant interpretations of data in serious scientific papers being reviewed for publication are not shared among all scientists.

Statement3: Thus, any slanted interpretations of scientific data will generally have been removed before publication.

Argument: Statement1: Ethicist : studies have documented the capacity of placebos to reduce pain in patients who believe that they are receiving beneficial drugs. Statement2: Some doctors say that they administer placebos because medically effective treatment reinforced by the placebo effect sometimes helps patients recover faster than good treatment alone. Statement3: But administering placebos is nonetheless ethically questionable, for even if a placebo benefits a patient, a doctor might, for example, have prescribed it just to give the patient satisfaction that something was being done.
Premise1: The motivation for administering a placebo can be relevant to the ethical justification for doing so.
Premise2: The pain relief produced by the placebo effect justifies the deception involved in administering a placebo.

input_info.Om: Premise2: The pain relief produced by the placebo effect justifies the deception involved in administering a placebo.
input_info.O: Premise1: The motivation for administering a placebo can be relevant to the ethical justification for doing so.
input_info.P: Statement1: Ethicist : studies have documented the capacity of placebos to reduce pain in patients who believe that they are receiving beneficial drugs. Statement2: Some doctors say that they administer placebos because medically effective treatment reinforced by the placebo effect sometimes helps patients recover faster than good treatment alone. Statement3: One viable way of addressing this problem would be to empty and then immediately refill the tanks in midocean, since midocean creatures and coastal sea creatures usually can not survive in one another's habitats.

output: Statement1: All oceangoing ships carry seawater ballast tanks whose weight improves stability. Statement2: To maintain the ship's proper stability, water must be pumped out of these tanks when cargo is loaded and into them when cargo is unloaded. As a result, sea creatures often get into the tanks and are then inadvertently deposited into new habitats, where they can wreak ecological havoc. input_info.O: Premise1: There are at least some oceangoing ships whose stability could be adequately maintained while emptying and refilling their ballast tanks in midocean.
input_info.P: Statement1: All oceangoing ships carry seawater ballast tanks whose weight improves stability. Statement2: To maintain the ship's proper stability, water must be pumped out of these tanks when cargo is loaded and into them when cargo is unloaded. As a result, sea creatures often get into the tanks and are then inadvertently deposited into new habitats, where they can wreak ecological havoc. Statement2: Although the vast majority of substations in the country only handle currents between 1 % and 2 % of their maximum capacity, and currents are expected to rise, perhaps by as much as a factor of 3 in the next decade, because of population increase and the increased demand from both industry and electronics in individual homes.

input_info.Q: Which of the following is an assumption of the above argument?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Many electrical substations in operation today are old, and have several aged components that could break down, leading to power failures, even if current levels don't increase substantially.
input_info.O: Premise1: An electrical substation fails when the current it handles rises above its maximum capacity.
input_info.P: Statement1: In the next decade, a large percentage of municipalities throughout the country will experience power failures if they do not modernize their electrical substations. Statement2: The vast majority of substations in the country already handle currents between 60 % and 80 % of their maximum capacity, and currents are expected to rise, perhaps by as much as a factor of 3 in the next decade, because of population increase and the increased demand from both industry and electronics in individual homes.
